page.title: 03Buildings, Rangeworthy
page.content: {Holy Trinity Church}was originally a Norman building and you can see the Norman arches inside. It was restored and extended in the nineteenth century. It has stained glass windows which were all put in since 1900 and a stone pulpit. An unusual feature is the ugly carving of a man with bulging eyes and protruding teeth on the North wall of the East aisle. {Rangeworthy Court}was built as a country house in the seventeenth century. It is now a restaurant and hotel. {The school}was built in about 1870 of stone with a slate roof. {The Rose and Crown Inn}dates from about 1860 and was built on the site of an older inn which sold cider. {The old vicarage}was built in about 1860 and is now a private residence.
